body.name: Brother DCP-L2640DW Wireless Compact Monochrome Multi-Function Laser Printer with Copy and Scan, Duplex, Mobile, Black & White | Includes Refresh Subscription Trial(1), Amazon Dash Replenishment Ready
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 23 hrs 51 mins
features: BEST FOR SMALL BUSINESSES – Engineered for extraordinary productivity, the Brother DCP-L2640DW Monochrome (Black & White) 3-in-1 combines laser printer, scanner, copier in one compact footprint and delivers high-quality black & white prints

FAST PRINTER WITH EFFICIENT SCANNING – Produces documents quickly with print speeds up to 36 ppm(2) and scan speeds up to 23.6/7.9 ipm(3) (black/color). A 50-page auto document feeder(4) allows for convenient, time saving multi-page scanning and copying

FLEXIBLE CONNECTION OPTIONS – Easily navigate the changing demands of your business with secure multi-device connectivity via built-in dual-band wireless (2.4GHz / 5GHz) and Ethernet. Or connect locally to a single computer via USB interface

BROTHER MOBILE CONNECT APP – Print, scan, and manage your wireless printer anytime, from almost anywhere from your mobile device. Order Brother Genuine Supplies, track toner usage, and complete more work on-the-go(5)

CHOOSE BROTHER GENUINE TONER – When it’s time to replace your toner, be sure to choose Brother Genuine TN830 or TN830XL replacement toner. And with Refresh EZ Print Subscription Service, you’ll never worry about running out of toner again and you’ll enjoy savings of up to 50%(6) on Brother Genuine Toner. Get started with Refresh today with a Free Trial(1)
body.description: With the Brother DCP-L2640DW Monochrome (Black & White) Multi-Function Laser Printer, you can scan, copy, and produce professional-quality prints quickly, easily, and efficiently. Combining three critical business functions into one compact footprint, this wireless small business printer is the smart way to create and share pristine prints, economize workspaces, simplify supply management, and reach your operational goals. An effective-and-affordable choice for high-volume printing, copying, and scanning, it prints up to 36 pages per minute(2) (ppm); features a 50-page auto document feeder(4) to expedite multi-page copy and scan jobs; and has a 250-sheet paper tray(4) to decrease how often you refill the paper. Its streamlined footprint means you can fit this compact printer wherever you have space on your desktop. Plus, you can connect to any of your devices with a variety of flexible connection options, such as dual-band wireless, Ethernet, and USB 2.0. Eco-friendly features include Toner Save Mode to increase cartridge life and automatic duplex printing to reduce paper waste. Also, this b/w laser With the Brother DCP-L2640DW Monochrome (Black & White) Multi-Function Laser Printer, you can scan, copy, and produce professional-quality prints quickly, easily, and efficiently. Combining three critical business functions into one compact footprint, this wireless small business printer is the smart way to create and share pristine prints, economize workspaces, simplify supply management, and reach your operational goals. An effective-and-affordable choice for high-volume printing, copying, and scanning, it prints up to 36 pages per minute(2) (ppm); features a 50-page auto document feeder(4) to expedite multi-page copy and scan jobs; and has a 250-sheet paper tray(4) to decrease how often you refill the paper. Its streamlined footprint means you can fit this compact printer wherever you have space on your desktop. Plus, you can connect to any of your devices with a variety of flexible connection options, such as dual-band wireless, Ethernet, and USB 2.0. Eco-friendly features include Toner Save Mode to increase cartridge life and automatic duplex printing to reduce paper waste. Also, this b/w laser. Disclaimers 1. Requires enrollment in a monthly billed Brother Refresh EZ Print Subscription service plan based on monthly printed page allotments. Unused pages roll over, limitations apply. Additional page set charges and taxes apply during trial. Plan, options offer, and pricing subject to change. Open to new subscribers located in the contiguous United States only. After the free trial period your credit card will be charged on a monthly basis for the Plan Fee, Overages, and Taxes in accordance with the Terms of Service. Overage fees will apply during free trial. Your service will continue on a month-to-month basis until you cancel it. May be canceled at any time. Upon cancellation, cartridge will be deactivated and must be replaced at users’ expense in order to continue printing. 2. Based on one-sided printing. Change from default setting required. 3. Monochrome scan speed in accordance with ISO/IEC 17991 with all advanced features turned off, letter at 300dpi. 4. Maximum capacity based on using 20-lb. paper. 5. Free app download and wireless connection required. Compatibility may vary by device and operating system. 6. Based on monthly subscription cost in U.S. for Mono Laser Power Plan vs. average cost per page of eligible like standard capacity cartridges. Savings will vary based on Refresh EZ Print Subscription plan selected. ENERGY STAR and the ENERGY STAR mark are registered trademarks owned by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. Images are for illustrative purposes only. Specifications subject to change.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Top notch for an inexpensive AOI
reviews.reviewText: After 24 years, my Canon photocopier went belly up. Turns out you can't find a dedicated copy machine these days, only all in one printers. Okay. I already have two good HP laser printers in my home office so I thought I'd look at an inexpensive laser AIO to use primarily as a standalone copier. After a little checking around, the Brother L-2640DW seemed to fit my needs, has excellent reviews, and is at a very good price point. I didn't expect much for $200, but then again I don't need much from it other than to perform basic copying duties. Well, I am pleasantly surprised.The printer was very well packaged and is surprisingly well constructed. If you have any technical knowledge whatsoever, setup should go smoothly and quickly. It identified my WiFi network quickly and had no problem connecting (though it would have been easier if there was a keypad - even a virtual one on the screen - rather than having to scroll through the alphabet and digits to enter each character of the ssid). Software download and installation was flawless, easy, and quick. There is a software update you are prompted to install (which is done simply by highlighting the update and clicking on "OK"), and as has been previously mentioned that update is required for the scanning utility to work. I installed the driver s/w on several computers and all quickly identified and connected to the printer.Unpacking and physical set up took less than 15 minutes (including connecting to the network), and software another 10 -15 minutes. All in all, there's no way it should take anyone longer than 20 - 30 minutes to have the printer up and running. If you are looking for an all in one laser printer at a very reasonable price, I have no qualms recommending the L2640DW. The only drawback so far is that it does not handle legal size paper, but in my case that's not an issue since my HP MFP 281fdw does.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good basic All around Monochrome Printer
reviews.reviewText: I love Brother printers. They are more affordable then an HP, Toner lasts forever and just very durable and rugged. This printer is no exception. If you need just a basic Monochrome (No color) that also has a color scanner and Copier, this is the one for you.It also has Built in Wired and Wireless Networking. This printer DOES work with the Brother android and Apple apps and prints very nicely from you phone. This was a prerequisite for the client I purchased this for.The only thing I wish it had was a better way to navigate the menu system. Its using the arrow keys and the ok button. It works, just takes some getting used to.Same goes for entering the WiFi password. You have to arrow to each letter. Her password was all lowercase so that was easy but if you have symbols and uppercase that takes a little more time to enter. Another area that gave some issues, but setting up the Scan to PC funtion. I never could get it working properly. She also didnt need that function as you can do it right from the PC itself so we never spent too much time on it.Otherwise the printer is very fast and good quality printing, Durable and should last for many many years.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid and reliable machine
reviews.reviewText: I bought this machine for my home-based business. This is by far the BEST all-in-one machine I've had - and I've owned at least 10 different ones. If you are OK with the fact that it is only black and white (which I totally am), everything else about it is STELLAR. Simple to use software, no fluff, no pesky additional marketing, no drying ink, and no need to replace toner every two months. In fact, I've had this printer for 6 months so far, and there is plenty of toner left. Print quality is superb.Everything in this printer works as it should. The build is solid and reliable. I use it wirelessly, and it has been operating flawlessly with all my machines and phones. No Wi-Fi issues. In fact, printing from my iPhone is super easy. My friends and guests are nicely surprised when I tell them how easy it is to work with it. Solid 5 stars. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good printer, very reasonable disposables cost.
reviews.reviewText: This is my first laser printer and about 2200 pages in, it is shaping up to be a huge win in usage costs. I don't print a ton and certainly not dozens of pages at a time and never got close to the kind of yields promised by ink jet printers. This printer has lived up to its claimed prints per cartridge and delivered exceptional cost per page (about 2.5 cents per page for me so far). Printer delivers excellent quality text and fairly bad, but usable graphics. While the graphics are a bit of a disappointment, they are fine for the charts and line art stuff I might use for work, but not good for the pictures I used to include on my recipes. Still, removing pictures of food from my instructions for making food is a small price to pay for reliable, cheap printing … even if I really really like food (which I do)! Setup was simple and Linux support was flawless, a big plus. Large paper reservoir (much larger than any of my previous printers) is also a nice feature. The ADF is a bit of a let down, though it feeds reliably and reasonably quickly most scans end up noticeably skewed. Everything looks crisp and legible, just not straight. This can be fixed in software, but I was hoping for a more reliable feed when scanning multiple pages. ADF scanner also produces a lot of color aberration when scanning grey/black sections in color. Scanning in greyscale is fine, but that's no good if you have color on the pages that you want to preserve. Overall I'd absolutely purchase this printer again. If it lasts a couple years + I'll be a very satisfied customer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It’s a breeze!!
reviews.reviewText: Holy WOW! This printer offers so much! No wifi, no problem!! The printer it build with its own WiFi-direct! Just connect and print away!! Great quality, double side print! Lazer print, less waste, better value!!

Unlike some people here; I had no problem setting it up. Connection to WiFi was kind of funny without a physical keyboard, but it's the kind of thing you do once. Just insert the utilities CD and follow the instructions. I do agree it's REALLY noisy though. You may think the printer mechanically struggles to get the sheet from the tray and route it internally for printing, but it's not. For the price, can't complain much about that. The bottom line is that the printing quality/price ratio is excellent.
ESTOU COM A IMPRESSORA PARADA SEM FUNCIONAR PORQUE A PLACA DE REDE NÃO FUNCIONA

reviews.reviewTitle: One of the best I've experienced
reviews.reviewText: I've had at least four of these over several years, fast scan, reliable, price has gone up substantially since the first one but I still consider it best value for my applications. I always shop online for cheaper cartridges which helps substantiate the value

reviews.reviewTitle: Wireless is a big one for me
reviews.reviewText: Setup was easy and connecting to the WIFI was great. The printer is working good and the quality of print is great.My old Brother lasted 10 years and this is why I purchased another Brother printer and the best is that its wireless.

This is a good basic MFC printer. It lacks features of more uptodate MFC printers and scanning and setup is more complex given there is no touchscreen. It seems to use up a lot of toner more than what the manufacturer predicts. Pretty noisy machine as well. Small footprint.Overall - if you are looking for a basic MFC for home occasional use and basic functions (printer and copying), this works well. However, given it goesn't have a touch screen and lacks more advanced features. If you do lots of printing, scanning and such - I would recommend a higher model.For my specific basic purposes, this works at a good price. But I would recommend a higher model with more features and a touch screen.
